text: Bottle a orange colored beer with a beige head aroma malts fruits caramel dried fruits yeast spicy and hops flavor malts fruits citrus spicy dark fruits caramel alcohol and bitter hops

33 cl. bottle, bb 19 Jan 2018.Clear orange-copper with a lasting disc of spongy foam. Nose is rich caramel with some earthy orange, dates and maybe a touch of resin. Flavors of caramel, earthy toasted nut, vanilla, raisin and cherry. Long bitter finish has some wood and cocoa notes. Medium-heavy body has smooth low carbonation and a drinkable balance. Unlike any other Mild Ales Ive rated and seems more like a Barley Wine. Still a tasty brew however you classify it.

Bouteille (19 jan 2016-BB 19 jan 2018). De prime abord la robe est belle, cuivrée avec une belle mousse blanche. Le nez malté de caramel est envahissant, Une bouche chaude, épicée, caramel, longue, proche du barley wine, touche de poussière, bonne amertume. Jaime ce genre de bière.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles place. Thanks troubles. Hazy orange. Aroma of malt, caramel, a bit of toffee, some fruitiness, a bit of alcohol. Sweet, kinda boozy, some bitter hops, slightly stale. Medium-bodied.
Pours orange with a beige head, aroma of fruits, malt, hops, flavor of malt, hops, onion, tangerine, medium bodied
Bottle. Loads of malt in the aroma, barley wine feel, bit fruity, somehow dusty. Nice. Taste is pretty good, dark fruit, boozy sweetness, some caramel. Bit sticky. Like it a lot. Thick, treacle.

33cl bottle at home. Poirs a slight hazy orange brown colour with a creamy off-white head and visible carbonation on the glass. Aroma of caramel, hops, orange juice, toffee, ginger? Taste is medium sweet, light bitter with a soft dry amd warming finish. Notes of earth, roasted malts, caramel, grass, resin, alcohol. Texture is thick, medium to full bodied with flat carbonation
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Fajne, bogata słodowość, dużo karmelu, trochę tytoniowe, fajne chmiele.

330ml bottle. Bottled 24.02.15. BB 24.02.16. Slightly hazy amber colour. Medium white head. Earthy notes, sweetness, toffee in the aroma. Toffee, hints of smoke and bitterness at first. Earthy bitter notes in the middle. Sweetness, caramel and some alcochol as well in the end. Bitter, alcocholy aftertaste. Rather heavy bodied, rather low carbonated, quite alcocholy brew. Hard to say how aging has influenced this mild ale. In this condition rather heavy and alcocholy.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: slightly hazy light amber with medium off-white head. Aroma: caramel, toffee, citrus, trace of soap. A little bit metallic. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of caramel, sugar, citrus and licorice. Yeasty finish. Palate: medium bodied, thick, sticky texture and medium carbonation.

Kicsi, nem túl tartós hab, barnásvörös szín, szűretlen. Illata édeskés, karamelles, citrusos és déligyümölcsös. Édes, markánsan keserű, karamelles, déligyümölcsös ízek, erős, túlérett mandarinos és narancsos aromákkal. Testes, közepesen keserű és közepesen szénsavas. Finom sör, de túl édes.
This was a surprise. Big on flavour, citrus hop aroma, big toffee/caramel flavours.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours almost clear light amber with lazing offwhite head. Aroma has light malt, caramel, dried fruit, biscuit and toffee with grassy and piney hoppiness. Tadte is complex with dried fruits, caramel, light malt, bread, toffee and hoppy with grass and pine. Finish is quite sweet but still dry.

Bought in Edinburgh at BrewDog bottle shop based on recommendation. Simply stated - this is a great beer. It has a wonderful Carmel color with a rather cloudy profile since it is unclear unfiltered and still has yeast in the bottle. The flavor is as excellent balance between malt and hops. It reminds me of some American imperial IPAs, though it is sweeter and not a hop bomb. If you have the opportunity to try it, you will not be disappointed.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Creamy head. Cloudy ambr body.
Nose of malts, cream, yeast, hops, malts, caramel, hint of wood and some bread.
Flavours of rye, bread, toast, nuts, malts, crust, hops, caramel, light molasses, some dried leaves, light dry and bitter.
Flavour is bitter, malty, grainy, herbal, bread, light dry and some hoppy crust...
Low carbo, thick creamy silky mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Very nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Tasting at Matts; bottled 19Jan16, bb 19Jan18Cloudy amber color, small compact head. Chewy malts, sweet, with a quite strong bitter component, bitter almonds, and very light fruity esters.Very good, akin to some English Barley Wine.

12 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy opaque orange amber with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of dark dried fruits, stone fruits, and some pleasant liqueur warming. Flavour is along the same lines, with stone fruits, dark fruits, and a lovely warming effect. Very fruity, pleasantly boozy, and caramely on the finish. "Imperial mild" seems like an oxymoron, but whatever this is, its lovely.

Bottle. Poured clear dark amber color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with fair lacing. Moderate complex fruit and yeast aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium complex sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish with a small alcohol bite of moderate duration. Good complex beer.

330 ml flaske delt på RBHD-samling på Fjøløy. Klar kobberfarget kropp med lyst skumdekke. Friskog fruktig honningaktig kandissukker i nesa. Salt, bittersøtt og konsentrert tørket frukt. Kraftig smak og full kropp.
Shared bottle at RB/HD at Fjøløy 03.09.16. Almost clear orange. Beige head. Sevilla marmalade, bitter orange zest and a hint of chili in aroma and taste.

Pours clear amber/red with a small white head. Aroma of sweet candy, red ripe berries, cellar and dust. Taste is moderate/heavy sweet malty, marmelade, hard hoppy finish, strange, nut a must.
Shared bottle at local tasting, ØL øy, saturday 3.session..

33cl bottle. Color is dark orange to brown. Head is thin persistent and white to beige. Taste is light to medium sweetness. Medium bitterness. Aroma is spices, herbs, malt, hops, caramel, light roasted.
Hazy Amber coulered beer with off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt and fruity. Taste a bit syrup, spicy and a bitter aftertaste.

0,33l from bottle shared with kraddel. Bottled 19.01.2016. BB 19.01.2018. Amber hazy colour, small white head. smells of spices, marzipan, light fruity, peach, peppery. decent smell. full body, slick mouthfeel. tastes of spices, peppery, marzipan, nutty, bitter chocolate, light oxidized. finishes lightly earthy with notes of marzipan and spices. good one
Thnx to werckmeister. Pours unclear amber, white head. Smell is bit sweet , very creamy. Intense. Mild bitterness. Taste is sweet, very full, bit metallic. Full taste. Mild bitterness. Very creamy

Pours cloudy Amber with thin tan head. Nose is sweet and fruity. Aromas are toasted malts, caramel, resinous pine, dry fruits, a hint of almond maybe, like some other raters suggested? Low carbonation, full body. Long bitter and sweet finish. Well-balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy copper with low white head. Aroma of butterscotch, toffee, malt, alcohol. Taste is sweet and boozy, again butterscotch but also nuts and toffee, lingering alcohol warming finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Bottle at home in London - sourced from Eebria. Aged 1.5 years. Pours totally clear ruby with a frothy, light khaki head. The aroma holds dried berries, pine, toasty crackers, some earth, grass, orange peel. Medium to heavy sweet flavour with gooey ripe berries, oily piney bitterness, grainy bread, rindy citrus, orange, fruit leather. Full bodied with chewy, with fine to average carbonation. Warming and resinous on the finish, with more ample pine notes, alcohol, leathery berries, subtle caramel, earth, leaves. An interesting and fun beer. Nice complexity, although I couldnt see myself drinking a lot of this.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear dark amber brown beer with no carbonation and small ivory head. Smell: full toffee nose. Caramel and wood notes. Caramel malt, alcohol finish. Quiet similar nose as a Barley Wine. Taste: full body with caramel malt and toffee domination. Very intensive caramel and toffee notes. Sweet, and good bitterness. Alcohol finish. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: alcohol with toffee caramel malt. Sweet finish.

It didnt start off to good. Nothing special looking at it, and the aromas where a bit weak. Some sweet notes there. (Maybe I had a bit of a cold?) The taste is fantastic though! Sweet, spicy, herbal taste. You can roll it around your mouth for a solid 10 seconds and the flavors keeps on changing. Caramel, vanilla, banana, some fruits. Finish leaves a lingering sensation that you need to take another sip.

This beer was not really good. Just as this match.Iceland - England 2-1Had higher hopes for both. Both looked actually good. England for 5 minutes. The beer had a lovely deep golden color with a thick off white head that lasted longer than England. Good intensity in the aroma. The match stinked. Full body. Also the English players. Soft carbonation. Iceland worked hard, not the other team. To sweet with not much bitterness to back it up. The match was the orther way around. Bitter. Way to much caramel and rich dried fruits. No caramel for the players from the big iseland. Iceland got all the sweet fruits. Actually a lot better when it got really warm. If Rashford did not warm up that long, the result might have changed a lot.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

Dal colore ambrato con riflessi rossi, schiuma biancastra gialla, al naso dolce, note di malto, frutta. Non è molto carbonata e i 9% si avvertono, ma è piacevole sia per il sapore che per il corpo. Resta prettamente dolce, con un accenno di amaro a bilanciare nel finale.

Bottle at mother kellys. A mostly clear caramel amber coloured pour with a lasting beige head. Aroma is spicy fuggy pudding, warming alcohol, nutty caramel malts, toffee. Flavour is composed of nutty rich cakey malts, grain husks, hints of toast, spicy dried fruits. Palate is medium bodied, semi sweet, moderate carbonation. Lovely rich mild.

Bottle @ Mother Kellys. Deep Amber pour with a massive creamy white head. Nose of tobacco, caramel, baked donuts. But. Rich, malty , a bit earthy. Similar flavor. Nice and rich malt-forward profile. Plum and toasted grain. Full body, pilowy carb. Great.

I had the beer at the Kaapse Brouwers 2nd anniversary festival. The beer looks nice. The color is a brownish amber and the beer has a little cloudiness. A nice layer of off-white foam is formed on top, which collapses quickly. The smell is a little bitter and contains aromas of almonds, hay and some raisins. It reminds me of something. The smell isnt very complex (or should I say that it is simple). The taste is better. It has some features of a barley wine. There is a nicely balanced bitterness and sweetness. I also taste some almonds. The beer is not bad, just a little bit simple. It reminds me a little of the Brown Paper Bag Howrye I had in Ireland, which is a compliment.
Bärnstensfärgad öl med gräddvitt skum. Doft och smak av malt, kryddighet och viss fruktighet. En aning kåda i humlebeskan.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours hazy amber with a thin off white head. Citrussy malt aroma. The taste has toffee, caramel, citrus and pine. Quite a bit of marmalade goig on too. Nice full mouthfeel. Very tasty.

Draft at the Oedipus Brewery on 27-May-2016, served in an Oedipus stemmed tulip glass. Brownish amber colour with a small beige coloured head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, spices and pine. Medium body and soft/medium carbonation. Flavour of caramel, spices - sweet at first but then the spicy bitterness takes over. Medium hopped. A nice fruity hopped high ABV mild. Reminded me a lot of the Evil Twin / Beavertown XXX Imperial British style Mild which also checked-in at 9.5% ABV - this is a very good ale.
Caramel and hoppy with a slight booze aroma ,a deep red pour with a slight haze .very sweet but the booze carries it. Light carb with a full body and many legs

Bottle from systembolaget Nyköping. Amber color with white head. Aroma has caramel, cereal and grain. Taste is sweet malty with long quite bitter and dry aftertaste. Caramel, alcohol, biscuits and dark fruits.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Takeover, Fermentoren, Copenhagen (10/05/2016) - amber brown pour with off-white head. Aroma and taste is medium sweet malty, slight roasted, some caramel, biscuit, light nutty, dark dried fruits, medium sweet malty into the finish.

7.5cl sample at the Ghent Beer Festival VI (22 VIII 2015). Old ale brew from Buxton, Oedipus and Rooie Dop, from an 1832 recipe. This Ring Your Mother is an English mild ale (apparently; did not know this style), orange coloured with a lovely off-white foam on top. The nose has lots of rye and smoked features. Teh carbonation is low, the body is rather sweetened and malted.

Flaska ebest SB. Klar bärnstensfärgad med ett fint smutsvitt skum. Alkoholen är väldigt framträdande i såväl smak som doft till en början. När temperaturen landar på runt 15-16 grader utvecklas den här ölen från en tämligen medioker och alkoholstinn sak till en ren njutning. Där fudge, apelsin, trä, socker, läder och torkad aprikos samsas mycket väl. Fyllig kropp. Mjuk och len munkänsla. Till slut är alkoholen mer värmande än förstörande och slutintrycket blir mycket bra. Det gällde bara att ha tålamod.
From tap at Fermentoren. Dark amber colour with an off-white head.maroma and flavour of malt, caramel, bitterness, fruit and hops.
Draft. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, butterscotch, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, and caramel, leading to a dry finish.
From tap. Pours clear and golden amber with a small white head. Aroma is grainy and toasted dark malty. Thick malty, sweet, toasted. Bitter and roasted. Light herbal. Dry and toasted finish.

Intense bread and grain malts, light caramel, light straw, light floral hops. Clear, dark gold, massive, frothy, off-white head. Light bitter. Caramel coming up quickly, bittersweet oranges, alcohol, sweet sticky texture at first, turning quite bitter and dry with alcohol in the finish. Exceptionally nice Mild, great malty flavours, very intense and complex palate. Bottle from brewery (via Eebria), Buxton.

On tap @ Oproer. The aroma has toffee, orange, raisin. Bit hazy, orange coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is moderate sweet, bit bitter, has sugar, toffee, oranges, raisins, hint of vanilla. Creamy mouthfeel. Full bodied. Good stuff.

330ml bottle. Clear redish brown with one finger beige head. Aroma is slightly burnt toffee, fudge, caramel, slight citrus and light grassy. Taste is toffee, fudge, caramel, light ash, light grass, sweet bread and roasted malts. Medium mouthfeel, low carbonation and slightly burnt, ashy malty aftertaste.

33 cl bottle @ home. Bottled 24.02.2015, BBE 24.02.2016
Aroma has caramel and toffee also grain and cereal. Flavour has alcohol, fruits, biscuits and cereal. Too boozy to be enjoyable.

In de Top 50 komen van bier genre Mild Ale zonder er één te zijn je moet het maar doen!
Amberkleurig bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: Amerikaanse hop, geranium, wat kaasachtig. Smaak: prikkelend bitter, dennenhars, wat zoetig. Afdronk: blijft prikkelen en je gehemelte kietelen. Zeer leuke double ipa!

330ml bottle. Mid amber shade with off-white head. Smells like a booze-soaked fruit cake. Taste is a similar experience. Orange peel and bready. Better drinkability than the boozy aroma hinted at. This aint bad but Im struggling to see why its ranked so highly.

330ml bottle. Deep orange amber colour with an off-white foam head. Aroma of malt, toffee & orange hop. Taste is similar, sweetish malty, toffee, caramel, sugar, dried fruity, orange citrus hop, raisins, with warm booze and earthy grassy bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry light warm finish. Nicely drinkable.

Growler at Adam Birthday party Amsterdam Netherlands.26.03.2016.Pour it clear orange color with small white head.Aroma of sweet fruits,malty and candy sugar on the back.Taste wau great complexed of sweet caramel caracther,dried fruits,raisins,figs,maybe plum,just a touch of bitter at the end,alcohol present in a good way.Perfectly balanced with full body.Great.
Bottle from house of trembling madness York a clear deep amber colour beer aroma is dried fruit carmel flavour is raisins toffee sweet carmel with big hoppy finish
Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weeken 2016, Tallinn. Colour is clear light brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, dryness and malts.
How: bottle Appearance: clear amber with a small white head. Aroma: ripe fruit, grass, caramel, booze, pine and nuts. Palate: medium to full body, average carbonation.

Lively amber beer with a thin beige head. Aroma of sour fruit and malt. Sweet malty hit up front, some tartness in there too. Theres a bit of a hoppy kick with the fruit as well. A bit of liqourice in the aftertaste as well, which Im not a huge fan of.

Hel klar, bärnstens färgad, snyggt tätt orange skum av små bubblor som faller ganska snabbt. Doft: Nöt kola, godis humle, dadlar, barley wine toner, marmelad av mörka bär. Smak: Som doft, minus marmeladen, plus lite citrus. Trevlig överraskning, klart över förväntan.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Hazy amber with an orange head. 
Sweet and a bit vinous, fruity aroma. 
Slightly alcoholic flavour with marzipan, oranges and sweet dried fruits.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, bottled in January 2016. Clear, reddish amber with a thin, frothy, stable, tan head. Sweetish and slightly fruity aroma of caramel, raisins, apricot jam, some licorice and vanilla. Very sweet and minimally fruity taste of caramel, raisins, vanilla, licorice and apricot jam, followed by a medium long, roasty-bitter, slightly warming-boozy finish with some herbal notes. Medium to full body, creamy to oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Interesting stuff, I quite like it, but some ageing might be beneficial.

How: Bottle.
Where: Shared by rlgk, thanks!
Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Caramel, sweet malt, floral, hops, dried fruit.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Liquorice, malt, alcohol, caramel, sugary.
sample from draft, poured a murky chesnut colour with a slight off head. nose of sweet burned caramel, raisins, caramel malt, nuts, earth, dried fruits, figs. smooth mouthfeel.

Bärnsten och en maltig doft. Söt och tung smak med en spritighet som slår igenom allt för mycket.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear, dirty bronze colour. Aroma has some pepper, malt, toffee. Taste is fairly spicy. Texture is incredibly smooth, almost oily.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Almost clear amber / dark golden, medium size head, good lacing. Strong aroma, alcohol, white pepper, caramel and fruit. Silky mouthfeel, mildly carbonated. Malty taste caramel, strong alcohol, dark sugar and white pepper. Dominating alcohol notes that are above all other flavors.

Pours a reddish amber with a large creamy off white head. Aromas of caramel, figs, dates, toffee, ripe apple. Taste is quite bitter with caramel sweetness and some jam fruitiness. Mouthfeel is slightly oily with medium body and carbonation.

Bottled:Pours clear, dark amber with a mid-sized head. Aroma sweet with notes of caramel and hops. Sweet, malty taste with notes of hazelnuts, caramel and hops. Bitter, somewhat boozy and warming finish.Tastes like a young Thomas Hardys Ale.

Hazy dark orange color with beige head. Aroma is earthy with some weird funk in the background. Taste is slightly sweet at first but gets really dusty, earthy and bitter on the finish. Medium body and carbonation, slightly boozy. Really weird beer, I didnt quite enjoy it.
330 ml bottle at Williams. Amber with off white head. Aroma malty, nutty, slight alcohol, dried fruit and grass. Taste is malty and boozy, slight dried fruit, nuts with a hoppy grassy finish. Ok
@ Kristoffers väg 17/3-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty and fruity with caramel and toffee. Body is medium, the finish is dry and bitter with warming alcohol.
Amberfarget klar med høyt kremete beige skum. Lukter nøtter, karamell og mørke frukter. Fyldig. Bittersøtlig nøtter, brent karamell, anis og alkohol. Alkoholen og anisen sitter lenge.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy amber body with a dense off-white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of plum, nail varnish and strawberry syrup. Flavour of honey, caramel, peppery spice and boozy cherry with a warming alcohol finish. Medium to full body with a syrupy texture. Sticky mouthfeel. A bit weird and not particularly enjoyable. Is this really a Mild and not a Barley Wine?

33cl flesje via drankgigant.nl
Alcoholpercentage van 9,5%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: donkeroranje met schuimkraag die meteen wegtrekt

Aroma en smaak: neus is lekker fruitig en hoppig, smaak is fruitig, abrikoos, tropisch fruit, pijnboom, flink bitter

Conclusie: lekker straffe ale

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear dark amber with minimal bronze head
Aromas of bready malts, butter, caramel, herbs
Taste has caramel, buttery bready malts, herbal hoppyness
High bitterness, medium sweet, medium carbonation

Bottle at home, 6th March 16. Pours a copper fairly flat beer, little or no head. Aroma is toffee, butter scotch, creme brûlée. Taste is burnt caramel, bitter creme brûlée topping, slight smoke, lingering bitter sweet finish. Good stuff

Bottle from SB.
Clear copper/dark amber, short nicotine yellow bubbly head. 
Sweet peppery, leathery, caramel, vanilla, bubblegum and figs and prunes in the aroma.
Sweet, peppery and leathery with dried fruit vanilla and caramel. Big alcohol and pepper/herbal finish.
Big boozy body, slight scrubbing carbonation, oily sticky texture.
Touch to drink, but interesting flavours and quite complex. Would be interesting to try with some age. It has an acidic note I dont like ghough.
A mild, no! This has the yeasty bread aroma of a barley wine, there is a hop bitterness in the finish, its an interesting, beer.

Bottle from web SB cons 2016-03-05 Göteborg
AR: brittish dried fruit cake, orange zest, 
AP: hazy amber, frothy ofwhite head
F: full bodied, Cointreu, brittish fruit cake, thick fluid, is this s Mild? - best I had anyhow;)
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 @ Havregatan 20160305. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, caramely and fruity, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter, malty and caramely.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Hazy amber, small head. Caramelly nose with with pepper and peach. Sweet with full body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Caramel, peach and vanilla. Seriously resiny. Edgy, but with an underlying depth. Warming, peppery resiny barley wine.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark golden colour beer with a medium head. Malty, yeasty and hoppy with an alcoholic touch. Dry warm alcoholic finish

Jammy, orange marmalade, earthy, alcohol, lightly roasty, just a whisper, bread, grassy, english as can be but turned up to eleven, hint of citrus
Amber colour, medium beige head, lacing.
British beer for the (post) modern era. The DNA is unmistakeable. The earthy, lightly perfumy hops, jam, the malts grainy, not caramely, noticable bite, noticably sweet, perfectly balanced, none overtaking the other, ABV evident, but well integrated.
Fullbodied, average carbonation, long complex hoppy and malty finish.
Just great.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear amber with some tiny floaters. Bready malt aroma, some fruity and earthy notes, floral hops. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness. Historically accurate or not, this was a good beer.
Bottle from SB. Copper body with a medium head. Pear, slight spicyness, butterscotch, wood, caramel.
Bottle from SB. Reddish amber with a thik off white head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, nuts and hops. Full body with a long bitter sweet finish.

Bottle from hops & crafts Exeter. Pours hazy Amber , lovely strong aroma of bitter hops pear,,pepper & sweet malt. Taste Hop fruity & bitter with sweet malt ,medium bodied & very drinkable for 9%+ alcohol thou present is not to obvious ,marmalade hop,bitter,sweet malt fnish with good dryness . This is a gorgeous beer but definitely not a mild . Tastes like a ESB crossed with a barley wine,thou still a fantastic beer & dangerously drinkable !
Flaska från SB. Kopparfärgad med smutsvitt skum. Söt kryddig doft med karamell och knäck. Smak av karamell och skaplig beska.
Flaska systembolaget. Bärnstensfärgad vätska. Djup och mustig doft av trä, rök och knäck. Ganska vass smak med alkoholtouch. Knäck, tjära och lite torkad frukt. Härligt "seg" konsistens.

Söt kola smörig, godiskaramellig doft med inslag av tuggummi & mörka bär. Mörk bärnstensfärg med bra vitt huve.samma går igen i smaken, söt, sliskig, godis smak, tuggumi, karamell, man känner värmande alkohol i eftersmaken i en ganska tunn kropp & mörka bär, låg bitterhet men den finns där, lite smått torr i finishen

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

15th February 2016Hazy deep gold - amber beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is smooth and a little dry, reasonable fine carbonation. The malts feel a little thin but bring good flavours of cream and caramel. Fair bit of spice and aniseed. Mild dried fruits. Touch of hoppy orange and hop spice. Light semi dry finish. Nicely put together but hardly a mild mild and that is a good thing for me. Too many mild seem like an excuse to brew a dull beer.

Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, torkad frukt, marzipan, farinsocker, persika med toner av örter. Rund och len, stor sötma, alkoholen slår kraftigt igenom, lätt beska av tall och grapefrukt. Skulle nog tjäna på att stå några år.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden/amber beer with a nice offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, fruity, marzipan, grapes, floral notes. Hoppy caramel flavor, citrus, marzipan, boozy and kinda sweet.

Clear, Deep golden with an orangey yellow head. Slightly boozy, warming spice aroma with an orange-like citrus character. flavour is citrus, mainly orange-like with a bitterness to suit. Mouthfeel is medium, not lacking thickness, with a somewhat slick finish. Overall impression is definitely orange. The alcohol harshness and moreso the bitterness is pretty intense which makes this a memorable brew but not a hugely pleasant one. Hard to know if this is really similar to any actual historical beer. Somehow it would surprise me

330ml Bottle - Amber in colour. Caramel, pine, sultanas and peach in the aroma. Hoppy, biscuity and slightly earthy taste with caramel, fudge, peach, sultanas and a hint of grapefruit. Probably the hoppiest mild I have ever had so whilst the grist recipe might date from 1832, the hops certainly dont! Nice though.
0,33l fles gedeeld net Lion. Amber met een crème kraag. Geur en smaak zoet met rozenbottel en mango. Afdronk met pine

Werent sure what should I expect from this one. Quite interesting experiment.

Appearance: nice, deep, amber color, not very carbonated.
Aroma: sweet, very strong alcohol note, malty.
Taste: too flat for this percentage, sweet, leaving strange aftertaste I cant really describe.

Overall it is nice to try this one regarding too history of this beer, but do not expect some incredible aroma or taste.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a slightly hazy dark amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is sweet malt, mineral. The flavour is moderate sweet with a smooth sweet hop bitter palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared thanks to Jmgreenuk. Hazy amber brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel, butterscotch, candy and sweet red berries. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours deep amber, nose is toffee, smoky, meaty, malty, taste is bitter, malty, caramel, sweet.

Bottle 330 ml, pours slightly hazy amber with creamy white head, that reduces to a nice lacing after a while. Aroma of caramel, flowers, hard candy, red fruits and a touch of cherry brandy. High sweetness in taste combined with some hoppy bitterness. Nice surprise.
From tap at Nederlandse Bieren Festival Delft. Barleywine achtige vette amber. Hoppig als de neten. Erg lekker.. Backlog from 2015/06/28.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy brownish with tan head. 
Aroma malty sweets, caramel, dough, candy sugar, fruity hops, toffee, mint. 
Taste caramel toffee sweets, little earthy bitter. 
Mouthfeel thick. 
Great Beer.

Hazy amber, nice head. Aroma is very malty - hay, cereal, bread, caramel, bit alcoholic. After warming nice fruitscame out. Light body, medium to heavy sweetness. Again very malty, biscuits, herbal notes, bit fruity, again alcohol. Quite light. Hoppy finish.

Pours hazy amber color with a small head. Aroma is quite in-your-face, lots of fruits, alcohol, hay and herbs and caramel. Boozy flavor, fruity, some wheat and yeast, faint toffee notes, bread. Sweet overall, aggressive yet soft, alcohol present.

Bottle and Friends of Ham in Leeds. Surprisingly this had no head it which was disappointing. This for a strong beer tasted very light and mild, but was somewhat underwhelming and lacked complexity as Id had high hopes for this. No t that its bad.

Bottle. Semi-hazy amber body with a medium to small head. Aroma has sweet English hops, toffee and some herbs. Sweet caramelly taste with toffee, mint and plenty of English hops. A decent barley wine. Im no expert on Mild Ales but this is pretty heavily contradicting the style guidelines here. No hop aroma or flavours and 3-4% ABV? Lets be clear - this is a hoppy and alcoholic beer. So this is like putting an Imperial Stout into "Low Alcohol" category because depending from the circumstances, 10% ABV can sometimes mean "too little alcohol", right?

Fra kran på Haand Ølfestival 29 Mai 15. Delt med Rune. Mørk gylden. Lavt skum med litt farge. Svakt fruktig aroma med innslag av krydder. Smaken mandler & lett tørket frukt - men alkoholen slår til og ødelegger.
Haand Ølfestival 2015. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is alcohol, malt, hop. Flavour is alcohol, malt, hop, berries, fruit, caramel, citrus, grapes , bread. Nice beer.

Appearance: Clear amber with a 2 fingers sized white head. Light lacing
Aroma: Sweet malts and nuts.
Taste: A sweet beer but it works as there is a nice complex palate, soft sugary, caramelise malts, herbs, nuts , strawberry jelly, cognac, vanilla, some orange and pine 

hops bitterness in the finish. 
Medium to full body, with soft carbonation. Nice one.
330ml bottle. Pours hazy amber. Tangy fruity malt flavours with a moderate hoppiness. Some carmamel and dried fruits. Alright.

330ml bottle. Cloudy, reddish golen colour with small to average, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Malty and slightly fruity aroma, hints of almond, marzipan, red berries. Taste is bitter hoppy and malty, notes of bitter almond, a touch of marzipan; some warming alcohol in the finish. Barley Wine-borrowings, no depth, no complexity.

Aroma is stuffed with notes from vanilla, sweet malts, toffee, fudge and subtle hops. Taste is lovely and its a little bit sticky in the mouthfeel. Brown sugar, nuts, figs, earth, bread and a discrete sting of alcohol in the end. Well its a stew of classic English taste sensations on steroids. This is an old recipe from 1832 apparently, so while I go call my mum, you guys over at the breweries can go dig for some more old shit to resurrect, cause this was awesome!

22/08/2015  sample (bottle) @ Gents Bierfestival shared with JorisPPattyn, Sebletitje, 77ships & PriorL
Orange colour. Nose is malty, spices. Taste is bitter, a bit soapy instead of creamy, caramel, ..;

22/VIII/15 - 33cl bottle @ 6de Gents Bierfestival - BB: 24/II/16, bottled: 24/II/15 (2015-1115) 
Clear orange beer, creamy beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very malty, sweet, sugary, dried fruits, caramel, raisins. Much complex! Such wow! Very odour! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet malty start, little bitter, caramel, bit sugary, dried fruits. Aftertaste: malts, nice bitterness, fruity, dried fruits, caramel, milk chocolate, soft bitterness, nice bitter touch.
Bottle at Gents Bierfestival. Cheesy, hoppy, very creamy, bitter, apples, nice but expected a bit more with all the raving reviews.

Surprisingly good beer. Doughy aroma, medium bodied, almost some viscosity. Toffee flavor. Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampled @ Gents Bierfestival 2015 Trübes orangegoldenes Bier mit einer geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch mild hopfig, bitter, harzig. Geschmack harzig bitter, sehr malzig, Karamell.
Clear. Light brown. Aromatic, floral, malty, sugary. Rich with caramel, malts and brown sugar.

Sample @ 6de Gents Bierfestival 2015.
Fin orangée, col léger blanc-cassé.
Arôme offre une fine note funk?, rappelant la cave, levure moyenne avec un rétro anglais dans les houblons.
Palais est malté, sorte de pale ale, mais dur de croire que cela pointe à 9%. Fini sec et poussiéreux avec un profil restant un peu trop centré sur la levure et un léger ajout fruité sortant soit de la levure ou des houblons.

Hazy dark amber reddish color, minimal head. Aroma of tropical fruits, caramel, hops and herbs. Sweet taste with medium bitterness in finish. Full body and soft carbonation. Interesting beer, more like hopped barley wine.

Almost no head; amber, fully hazy beer with a greenish sheen. Spicy nose, oatmeal, nutmeg, mildly peppery. Peppery, grainy, maltflavour. Other spices as well, none overpowering. Medium bodied, peppery feel keeps hanging around. Not stellar, but special and interesting enough!

Drinking from tab at Ubf 2015.
The unclear orange beer has a medium brown head.
In the taste liquorice. 
Medium carbonated

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 
Aroma:

Malts, caramel, liquorice, orange and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid orange/brown beer with a slight off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet, slightly bitter and dry with malts, caramel, liquorice, orange and hops.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange with a mostly fading bubbly head. Aroma of orange, apricot, woody, grassy. Taste is orange, raisins, wood, caramel. Very sweet. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Very nice.

Bottle @ Kufle i Kapsle. Hazy reddish amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, fruity and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. More double IPA than mild ale. 310715
Bottle @ Kufle i Kapsle, Warsaw. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, malt and has anice bitter fruity finish.

Bottle at home ... daark amber ... massive tan foam head ... sofrt woody fruit malt nose ... sweet oily woody fruits ... soft toffee ... oily orange ... soft bitter .. light herbal fruits ... light sweet sticky toffee fruits
330ml bottle. Pours dark orange with a small head. Aroma is orange squash, toffee and woody raisin. Taste has caramel to start with a woody, hoppy raisin finish. Full in the mouth.

Bottle at home from luviansslightly hazy pale chestnut amber with slightly savoury, minty, red berries. Fluffy beige head collapsing to lacing. Lively carbonation, cocoa, fruity, warming, sweet, slightly astringent, complex, cakey.

Opaque creamy amber, medium beige head. Sweet aroma, hints of almond, some grain and some toasty notes. Medium bodied, sweet with some bitter undertones. Light toffee with some vanilla, perhaps some treacle as well. Finishes a bit dry and bitter, with an underlying layer of warmth. Spectacular.

First mild ale of my rb career, best mild ale in category. Nice way to start. And its really awesome. I get nice mix of best qualities of other styles in here. Theres some Belgian yeasty infulence, some very decent hop profile, even for IPA, nice maltiness,
its kinda simple, but in same time very complex. Rich maltiness, caramel, intense fruitiness, grapefruit, herbal. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness. Very enjoyable
Mild English hops in aroma. Dense foam! Dense sweet bitter. Complex hard to describe taste. Lovely bitterness. Surprisingly light in taste.
Fantastic beer, very different from classic styles with different notes- Belgian, ipa, brown ale that come together in harmonized beauty :)

Butelka 0.33L. 
Wygląd: Ciemny bursztyn, klarowne. Piana ecru, obfita, średnio i drobnopęcherzykowa, średniotrwała, ładnie oblepia ścianki szkła.
Aromat: Lekkie chmielenie na zimno: ananas i cytrusy. Do tego sporo aromatów słodowych: karmel, biszkopt, nuty tostowe, orzech włoski. Wyczuwalny alkohol.
Odczucie: Pełne, oleisto-kremowe, średniowysycone.
Smak: Słodkie, przypiekane, palony cukier, karmel, sporo chmielu, grejpfruty, ananas i ziołowa nuta. Goryczka średnia, alkoholowo-chmielowa.
Całość: Ciekawe, choć za bardzo alkoholowe i lekko męczy bo przyciężkawe.

Tap at Delfts bierfestival. Clear amber with white head. Sweet malts and nuts, soft sugary notes with herb candies, strawberry jelly, cognac, vanilla. Over medium sweet. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Nice one.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. A hazy dark amber coloured beer that pours with a thin white head. It has a sweet, rich red fruity, orange marmalade and pine flavour, toffee and burnt currants with a smooth warming oak and vanilla finish. A superb American style Double IPA.

Bottle from hop hideout, sheffield. Clear amber with particles and a small white head. Aroma is malty and grassy. Taste is salty and savoury and bitter. Mildly carbonated and a nice oily body. Excellent.

Bottle, pours hazy amber with a white head. Caramel, tropical fruit, brambles, malty, white raisins, nuts, hint of mint, lavender. Sweet with moderate bitterness, sticky texture, full body, slick, grapefruity finish. A bit like a hoppy barley wine.
Amber colour with nice beige head. Sweet malty aroma, some caramel, hops , herbs and dried fruits. Gentle malty taste, caramel, fruits, some herbs delicate medium bitterness.

Draught. Dark amber, white head. In aroma malty and caramel notes mixed with dried fruits and tropical notes from hops. In taste similar but more hoppy, sweet with medium bitterness. Full to medium bodied, alcohol completely hidden (9,5 ABV!). Nice beer, of course not mild but something like maybe Imperial Amber?
Bottle. Amber color. Malty, nutty aroma, caramelly with hints of chocolate. malty sweet roasty nutty bitter flavor with licorice, raisin, caramel. Sticky mouthfeel, slightly alcoholic.

330 ml. bottle @ home. Purchased @ Kaapse Brouwers. Bottled on 24/02/2015. Lightly hazy dark amber, solid tanned head. Smell is huge on blue cheese hops, awesome with sweet cacao & chocolate cake, very creamy, I just adore it. Taste is bitter blue cheese hops, some floral & light bitterness, rather bitter in the finish, blue cheese apples dominate, the rest is cacao sweet & bitter with light chewy caramel, bitterness lingers a bit, sweet cooked apple, chewy toffee candy, sweet spice, very faint roast, Lightly boozy oddly. Bitterness lingers & dries out your mouth a bit. Creamy but sadly not as thick as I would have like or as thick & creamy as should be possible with this ABV, Still this flavor combination is totally up my alley, Soft carbonation, Drinks dangerously easy. Could have been even better but very lovely already. Just what I like.

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2015, Drammen
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, alcohol, citrus and grape. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, caramel, citrus and grape finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Tap at Haand Ølfestival, shared with Finn. Apricot coloured body. Missing head. Rings of lacing down the glass. Fruity hops, half-dry on the nose, hints of bread and almond. Citrus, apricot and almond to the taste buds. Prolonged ending with alcohol. Soft in the mouth. Okay, rather unimpressive though (Drammen 29.05.2015).

Pours deep golden red with a large lacing off-white head.... beautiful looking beer. Smells sweet malts, with mild hops. Tastes sweet, boozy, malty... caramel... quite like a barley wine really. Lovely and warming sipping beer. Great stuff.
Bottle. Golden and sweet with a strong presence of alcohol. Full bodied and left lots of lacing. A bit dimensional but still pretty impressive.
Pours cloudy deep golden. Aroma is malty, some alcohol. Taste is malty sweet, warming alcohol.

0,33L bottle (from Koht, Tallinn). Pours amber with beige head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malt, dusty, and earthy. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, caramel, and earthy notes. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: nice one.

Bottle from Beer Dock, Crewe. This beers very confusing. Initially I thought it was rank, then sweet toffee comes through and Im beginning to like, then the face pulling bitterness hits back. Hard work. Nah, not for me. Too much of a thing.

0,33 l bottle from Biervana BB 24. Feb 16 
Orange-amber color, hazy, frothy, tan foam. 
Aroma of dried fruits & tropical fruits + some caramel sweetness. 
Remarkably soft mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation, long and surprisingly bitter finish,

Interesting and tasty. Low but enough carbonation and almost no head. The alcohol is well hidden in the flavor. It starts malty sweet then quickly goes to a well hopped bitter flavor with spices and herbs. A bit medicinal but in a good way. It has a long dry bitter aftertaste. quite overwhelming but I like it.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel flavor with hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty caramel bitter hoppy finish.

Copper beer, small beuge head. Malty, hoppy, caramel nose. Flavor is malty and sweet, caramel. Finishes with herbal hops. ABV is very well hidden, there is a hint of in the aftertaste. The sweetness and the herbal hoppiness meld together pretty nicely. Not overly smooth, but I like it.

(Buxton / Oedipus / Rooie Dop Ring Your Mother 1832 XXXX Mild) I had this on tap at Utrechts Beer Festival and then I discovered a bottle in my fridge. Served into a teku, ABV 9.5%
Red coloured body, a bit hazy, with a tall and thick off-white head with very good retention, leaving medium lacing on the glass.
Aroma has light toffee, caramel, biscuit, english hops.
Nice hoppy taste, citrus, orange peel, caramel malts, notable alcohol, grass, some biscuit, light toffee, with a nice bitter finish and aftertaste.
Medium thin body, good carbonation.
Very good and big difference from the tap at the festival, it easily scored two more points.

van de tap op @UBF15, 
mooi rood nagenoeg kraagloos, aroma van graan, zoetig en alcoholisch. Smaken van graan, stevige smaken, matig kruidig, matig bittertje, caramel, goede smaken edoch geen topper.

Bottle at home, from Beer Gonzo, 09/05/15.
Rich amber to chestnut brown with a decent beige covering.
Nose is sweet malt, caramel, light hops, biscuit, light sherry woodness, trace of vanilla.
Taste comprises sweet caramel, vanilla, toffee fudge, light wood, nutty, toasted brown sugar.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, sweet licks in a drying close.
Decent enough offering, more akin to a barley wine ignoring the historical recipe context.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft pour. Pours a dark copper with a beige head of foam. Caramel and anise are strong in the aroma. Pretty strong alcohol in the taste, mostly anise sweetness. Big body and medium carbonation.
Donker oranje bier zonder schuim. Ruikt hoppig, kruidig en mout. Weer boerderij. Smaakt zoet, mout , kruidig. Lekker.

On tap at ubf. Body is opalescent ruby amber, head is big, tan, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is hemp, flavor is caramel, hazelnut, orange peel, spices, leaves, grass, very complex, excellent balance. Medium sweet, medium bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting light hoppy bittersweet, alcohol is totally hidden. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Excellent easy dessert beer, difficult to describe, great one!

A beautiful, amber colour, a head is medium and blond. Aroma is rich, dried fruits and brittish fruitcake, quite strong sweetness that is still natural, also fresh fruits. Taste has dried fruits, richness of malts, drying and herbal hops, also some pine wood. Almost full bodied, fresh anyway, low carbonation. Interesting and good beer. The great maltyness. To slow enjoyment.

Bottle from Luvians, St Andrews. Pours copper in colour. Little bit of lacing. Alcohol warmth on the nose. Spicy. Peppery hops. Caramelised orange. Bit of sherry booziness. Mouthfeel is lovely and chewy. Flavours of Caramel. Brioche breadiness comes through. Sweet but well balanced. Middlin bitterness on the finish. Easy drinking for its abv. Tasty!

330ml bottle. Hazy orange color. Small size, beige-yellow color, stays as a ring. Grainy, husky, light hops in aroma. Alcohol, husky grains, sweet (got to get that level of alcohol somehow right?), hazelnuts in taste. Hazelnuts and sweet alcohol in aftertaste. Good level of bittering hops. Feels and tastes boozy. Damn I think you ruined perfect mild with alcohol.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2015 330ml bottle (Speakeasy, Tallinn) (7:4:7:4:14=3.6)
Lovely malty aroma, husky, and dry. Pleasant esters as it warms. Nice slightly hazy orange, small head. Very nice grainy body, raw, husky, so much barley. Finish has plenty of bitter bite. Too much for an XXXX mild, Id say. Lovely husky bitterness in the finish. Very interesting brew, well-attuned to my tastes.
Rerate of: Tap (TCBW15) (4:3:3:2:6=1.8)
Smells of bum-holes. And grain. Sour mashy taste too. Tastes of frowns :-(. Ringpiece of your mother, more like. Some peas. Ewww, mess.

Draft @ Uiltje bar. Nothing mild about this bad boy. Pours a clear light brown beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma is very fruity, apple, light caramel malts. Flavor is mildly bitter, loads of citric influences in there, almost like an IIPA, a bit of a boozy sweetness in the back. Very powerful, loads of flavor and light carbonation. Good stuff, but strong.

Deceptive bugger with the 9,5%. Balanced, mild? Not really, bold more like it. Old recipe but feels west coasty.

Bottle from Sterk in Amsterdam.

Bottle. Dark brown with red and an off white foam. Aromas are toffee with spiced oranges and leafy hedgerow. Herbal with hints of mint and earthy hops. Nutty cocoa with tinned pineapple and lemon. Flavours are bittersweet lemon with low pine and toffee and caramel. Bready and addictive with peppery, woody, green pine. Herbal with a nutty finish. Easy going for its strength. Great.
Dark orange, off-white lacing foam. Strong hoppy aroma, although some herb tones present. Bitter taste, some banana notes. Decent beer. (Velp 201504)

Bottle. Pours amber with a mostly white head. Massively fresh and clean aroma yet pack with funky musty veg, citrus and overripe fruit too. Medium body, light to medium carbonation. Jammy, cakey, with resinous woody stuff, toast and marmalade, tobacco, ash, dark fruits... I could easily go on. Tasty.

Bottle. Buxton Tap House. Hazy, dark orange. Film of lasting, pale ginger head. Very appropriate, as this is spicy, and fruity. Toffee malts. Chewy hop. Drinks soft, full, chewy, verging on DIPA territory. Bit of a Barley Wine, fruity chewiness. Very full, and rich. Drinks 5.5%, not 9.5%. Lots of fruit. Nice hoppage. Very drinkable.

Bottle from Trafalgar Wines, Brighton. It pours clear deep amber with a decent white head. The nose is juicy, stewed orange, apple, candied peel, earth, toasted seeds, varnish, hay and spice. The taste is bitter-sweet, earth, wood, leather, toasted grass, light astringency, peppery spice, stewed orange and candied peel with a dry, warming finish. Full body and fine carbonation. Punchy and flavoursome. Good depth. A quaffable beverage for sure.

bottle. Pours a coppery body with a nice light tanned head. Heavy malty caramelly aroma. hints of piney hops. Malty taste with a well balanced bitterness. fairly bitter actually. close to full bodied with soft to avg co2.

33 cl bottle. Bottled on 24.02.2015. BBE 24.02.2016.
Pours hazy amber color with a small head. Aroma is quite in-your-face, lots of fruits, alcohol, hay and herbs and caramel. Boozy flavor, fruity, some wheat and yeast, faint toffee notes, bread. Sweet overall, aggressive yet soft, alcohol present. Quite a weird mesh. Not really sure what to think of this.
4423

330 ml bottle. Bottled 24/2/15. BB 24/2/16. Courtesy of lusikka. 
Hazy amber colour with a tiny off-white head.
The aroma is sweet malt, play dough and alcohol. 
The flavour is strong malt, some hoppy bitterness, sweetness and some alcohol. 
The strongest Mild Ale Ive ever tasted. More like a Barley Wine.

330 ml bottle. Pours an amber orange colour with a small head. Aroma of orange marmalade, hay and caramel. Some very intriguing modelling clay notes, which take me back in time. Flavour of sweet malts, English toffee, orange marmalade, hay, grassy bitterness and pear drops. Full bodied. Alcohol warms. Interesting.
Bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub. Clear amber color, average sized off-white head. Smell and taste malts, hops, yeast, caramel, a touch of wet leaves. Medium body, medium carbonation.
Drank in the bus on the way back to Holland after the BeerGeeks dat in Belgium. Sweet, subtle taste. Okay beer. However, also some hints of sour. Okay beer.

Bottle shared thanks to richthevillan. Amber beer with small head
 Aroma of malts and spices. Taste is caramel, malts and quite boozy. Oily palate. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Cotteridge Wines shared with Sarkynorthener; clear copper pour with a frothy off white head, big sweet aroma, taste has sweet caramel malts, some wet leaves, bitter finish.
Dark orange brown clear liquid, nice flowery hops, big caramel malts... great bitters and sweets in a big body with a malty finish... suprising style, good beer
Bottle at home. Sweet malty flavours. Piney notes aaand peanut butter. Oily texture. Interesting.

33cl Bottle from Sterk. Almost clear orange-amber colour, off-white head. Lightest colour for a mild Ive ever seen. Aroma is malty, alcohol, hops, apricot, toast, grain, caramel. Flavour is medium sweet, quite malty, toffee, toast, canned fruits, firm resinous and grassy bitter finish, light citrus, alcohol, quite some booze actually. Full bodied. More a bitter UK barley wine to me.
Bottle. Copper color, small head. Aroma of grain, spice and malt. Taste is quite malty, with anise, ginger and a soapy bitter finish. Weird beer. They should have left this recipw buried.
Amber beer, small white head. Aroma of malts, pine. Taste is bitter, some licorice, pine, caramel. Nice prickly feeling, bit sticky. Good!

Bottle. Amber hazy. Bit stuffy caramels on nose, sweet malty, light dry apricots, light raisins. Full bodied, bitter, citrus in flavour. Caramels, butterscotch, bready malts. The abv is somewhat hidden in the flavour, right now at least, but theres a lot of it in the aroma. Weird one, ok still.-- bb
Pours hazy brown orange with white fast vanishing head. Notes of citrus, caramel, nuts, malts. Alcohol well hidden.- beerbasher

Pours a caramel brown with a large beige head which soon reduces to a layer of froth. Aroma is malt and asian citrus fruits. Taste is malty, nutty, slight tropical fruits noticed and a long bitter and nutty finish. Full bodied with a fairly thick mouthfeel.m
Great hue, From certain angles a radioactive pinky red. Malty imperial stout esq aroma some hop coming through. Bubble gum, wood. Love the idea of imperial mild

33cl bottle at home. Hazy orange / brown with a small white soapy head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Pretty bitter with medium sweetness. Pine, grapefruit, caramel, peach, raisin, warming alcohol and spices. Wow, this is quite a nice hop bomb.

Bottle by allmyvinyl. Pours almost clear copper with beige head. Aroma is red fruits, IPA-style hoppy sweetness, but also plenty of malts, resin. Taste is smooth and sweet, berries, caramel, orange, bittersweet fruity finish.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - golden amber with a decent head. 
Nose - sour tangy fruit. Light malt. 
Taste - all oranges.
Palate - medium bodied with a medium textured with a dry tangy finish.
Overall - interesting.
Bottle shared with Ashton McCobb, jeevan and nihtila. Pours clear amber gold, thin off- white head. Aromas of malt, light sour sherbet. Taste is orange, pine. Oily texture, hot finish.
Poured reddish brown with a small tan head. Aroma of sweet fruit and toasted malt. Medium body, flavour is boozy, moderately sweet, vanilla smooth, dry, sweet and increasingly bitter finish.
Bottle from the beerhive. Hazy Amber brown. Off white head. Malts and caramel. Medium body, slightly oily. Malts and hops. ABV is pretty subtle. Bet the old recipes weren't this refined!

Glowing brown amber body and medium head. Rich amber malts, cereal, sticky fruit compote, resin hops. Taste is brilliant, heavy barley wine like, exactly what I wanted in this beer. Long bitter aftertaste. Dense and delicious. Nom nom nom. An excellent choice for my number 4000! (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
Superbly tight and densely woven whole of dark golden orange. Intensely bitter dry long middle palate with some restrained herbal notes. Colin Stronge, I salute you.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 Copper-coloured beer, slightly opaque.Caramel smell, quite salty, touch of leather, spices. Bit of resin.Taste is dry, bitter and watery. Nice sournesd. Oily thick beer. Bit schizophrenic, very British in general, the hoppiness throws it a bit of balance.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 Bitter silty light smokey aroma. Cloudy dark yellow colour, little white head. Starts very sweet hoppy, alcoholic. Very thick substance and tickling on the tongue. Lots of malts and bitter hay-like hops. Sweet malty and hay aftertaste. Interesting!

Bottle from Plan B, Rotterdam Sunday 15th March, consumed in Frank (camper) wild camping in a street central Poperinge, Belgium Wednesday 18th March 2015  Pours mid brown, pushy strength but not too boozy, earthy, woody and rustic but very nice. I am guessing that because this is an old recipe then the hops will also be traditional English hops, if so they come into their own in this style of beer.A little bitter caramel in the mouth, soft mouthfeel, not too sweet, its just very good. A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 3.9

330ml bottle, pours clear copper with an off white head. Sticky caramel malt, with pear, apple, bilberry, almond notes, resiny, well balanced with a moderate bitter long finish. Light medium body with an oily texture. Soft carbonation. For the ABV this one drinks nice and easy. Very nice brew

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2015 Bottle.Nose is very sweet, pear drops, caramel, malt, hint of nut. Taste is very nutty, with berry, blackcurrant, lots of caramel, malt, pear drops, a herbal slightly medicinal note from the hops, malt, Mouthfeel is thick and rich.

I loved this far more than I thought I would. It sounded gimicky, but as ever Buxton are wizards at thigh strength and this is so rich and delicious.

Bottle shared with and thanks to my buddy Ravi. Pours hazy copper with a short lived head. Aroma is metallic, citrus, 4MMP-ish, blackcurrant and caramel. Taste is quite bitter and moderate sweet. Full bodied with moderate carbo.

Bottle from The Bottle Shop Canterbury and drunk on Mothers Day 2015. Hazy russet lasting beige head. Some malt on the aroma. Malty and hoppy in the mouth some sweetness from the ABV. I do like the hops a lot though. Tastes like a big hit of East Kent Goldings and or Fuggles. Love the malts. And it doesnt taste of 9.5%. Shows what a strong mild used to be though. Pretty good.
On tap at the Buxton Brewery Tap House. Hazy Amber colour with an off white head. Aroma is fruit and nutty, the taste has more nuts but also a touch of hops. Nice beer and very easy to drink.
